questions.question: What is the largest organ in the human body?
questions.answer: The skin is the largest organ in the human body.

questions.question: How many bones are there in the adult human skeleton?
questions.answer: The adult human skeleton is made up of 206 bones.

questions.question: What is the name of the gland that produces hormones that regulate vital body functions?
The human heart has four chambers - the right atrium, right ventricle, left atrium, and left ventricle.
questions.answer: The human heart has four chambers - the right atrium, right ventricle, left atrium, and left ventricle.

questions.question: What is the name of the membrane that surrounds and protects the brain and spinal cord?
questions.answer: The meninges is the membrane that surrounds and protects the brain and spinal cord.

questions.question: How many permanent teeth does an adult human have?
questions.answer: An adult human has 32 permanent teeth.

questions.question: Can you help me?
questions.answer: Sure, what do you need help with?

questions.question: I have some questions about the human body.
How do humans build muscle?
questions.answer: The body repairs damaged fibers by fusing them, which increases the mass and size of the muscles.

questions.question: What are the best ways to get over the flu?
questions.answer: For most healthy children and adults, home care is the best way to treat flu. This includes rest, drinking plenty of fluids, and, if needed, taking over-the-counter medications to lower fevers or reduce muscle pain.

questions.question: How can I build muscle?
questions.answer: Go to the gym at least twice a week and work out specific muscle groups. Be sure to eat enough calorically and consume enough protein to repair tears in your muscles after working out.

questions.question: How can I live a healthier life?
questions.answer: Make sure you are eating whole, unprocessed foods throughout the day. Exercise and drink water, and you will see incredible health shifts!
